snippet: The arrest of Jason Rezaian of The Washington Post has alarmed the foreign press corps and highlights the split between Iran’s president and the state institutions that hold the real power.
abstract: Arrest of Iranian-American Jason Rezaian of The Washington Post, along with his journalist wife Yeganeh Salehi, by Iranian authorities alarms the foreign press corps and highlights split between Iran’s Pres Hassan Rouhani and state institutions that hold the real power; Post says it has not been given any explanation for Rezaian's arrest or any information on his condition.
lead_paragraph: The arrest of Jason Rezaian of The Washington Post has alarmed the foreign press corps and highlights the split between Iran’s president and the state institutions that hold the real power.

headline.seo: Jason Rezaian of Washington Post and Wife Still Held
headline.main: A U.S. Journalist’s Arrest Points to a Power Struggle in the Leadership of Iran
headline.print_headline: A U.S. Journalist’s Arrest Points to a Power Struggle in the Leadership of Iran
